title: BBC Local Live: Channel Islands on Tuesday 5 September 2017 - BBC News
summary: call for review of clinton pringle death case .
police investigate 'deliberate ' fire near dinosaur park .
urgent review call for guernsey 's population law .
police probe continues after festivalgoers taken to hospital .

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: our coverage across the channel islands has finished for the day .
we 'll be back on wednesday from 08:00 with the latest news , weather , travel and sport .
do n't forget bbc channel islands news on bbc one at 18:30 and 22:30 .

documents.title: constables waiting on permission to make bandstand alcohol free
text: the st peter port constables are waiting for permission from the states before they can make an area of the parish an alcohol free zone .
they want to make the area around the band stand on the corner of the grange and brock road alcohol free because `` the area is constantly being littered and spoilt '' .
that 's according to constable dennis le moignan who says they ca n't put the alcohol free signs up until they get approval .
he is pleading with islanders to treat the space with respect .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: fishing boat suffers engine failure
text: an alderney fishing boat was towed to safety after its engine failed four miles east of the island .
the 10m katie c was taken to braye harbour by the alderney lifeboat , which launched at 16:20 .
both boats were in the harbour by 17:30 .
author: Ben Chapple
BBC News Online

documents.title: multi-storey car parks to be refurbished
text: work on minden place and first tower will start on 18 september .
at minden place the layouts are being altered and some bays widened to make access to spaces easier , which will see a reduction in the number of spaces from 262 to 237 .
however , there will be four more spaces for bicycles and an extra 15 motorbikes .
it will be closed for the first four weeks of the changes and then floors will begin to be opened as they are ready .
first tower is due to remain open with the majority of the work taking place during the october half term .
the project will run over 14 weeks , finishing at the end of december .
author: Ben Chapple
BBC News Online

documents.title: gold coast games door slams shut
text: double island games beach volleyball bronze medallists ruben vieira and bero bobus have had their dreams of representing jersey at the commonwealth games crushed .
author: Jersey Evening Post

documents.title: weather : more showers expected , but a clear day ahead
text: there may be one or two showers tonight but for many it will stay dry with clear spells meaning it will turn a little cooler than recent nights .
minimum temperature : 15c ( 59f ) .
apart from the odd shower than can not be ruled out , wednesday will be a fine day with a decent amount of sunshine .
maximum temperature : 18c ( 64f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: consultation launched into discrimination law
text: a consultation has started into the final stage of jersey 's discrimination law .
it will see the law extended to include people with a disability .
jersey first introduced a discrimination law in 2013 , originally only covering racial discrimination but it has since been extended to cover age and gender .
this is the final stage .
the proposed law will give people the right to make a complaint to the employment and discrimination tribunal if they 've been discriminated at their work , school or other building .
there will be public meetings on 24 and 30 october at st paul 's centre and people can comment online until 10 november .
author: Ryan Morrison
BBC News Online

documents.title: court 's billion-dollar global finance crash case ends
text: guernsey 's largest-ever court case was finally concluded yesterday morning when the royal court ruled against a near $ 2 billion claim from liquidators of the guernsey-based fund carlyle capital corporation .
author: Guernsey Press

documents.title: guernsey hotel to close in october
text: a guernsey west coast hotel will close its doors for the final time this year .
it 's one of the island 's only two star hotels .
the l'eree bay hotel will shut on the last sunday in october .
it has 33 ensuite rooms , sea views and a swimming pool .
it 's unclear what will happen to the building , which is owned by randalls brewery .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: school dental scheme could be extended
text: a scheme teaching children how to clean and look after their teeth could be launched in more schools in jersey .
education minister , deputy rod bryans , is meeting the charity that teaches dental health in schools , the super smiles charity , to discuss expanding the scheme .
it was set up by a former states dentist who says the current free scheme at the hospital needs to change as there is currently a waiting list for an appointment of more than a year .
deputy bryans says it is up to head teachers whether to include the sessions on dental health in their schools .
author: Ryan Morrison
BBC News Online

documents.title: preparation work on £ 17m substation is completed
text: works to prepare the site for the £ 17 million west st helier primary substation have been completed and contractors are now beginning to build the facility .
author: Jersey Evening Post

documents.title: population regime 'a barrier to economic growth '
text: guernsey 's population management law is creating an extra barrier to economic growth , according to the confederation of guernsey industry .
chairman clive mcminn says overseas labour is crucial for some economic sectors including hospitality .
he says since the introduction it has proved difficult to recruit staff and processing licence applications is taking a long time .
deputy mary lowe , home affairs president , says there are benefits to the new system and the lack of staff for hospitality is n't a new problem .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: recycling in st john 'behind decline in waste '
text: the amount of household waste collected by the st john kerbside recycling scheme has fallen consistently in the past four years , a freedom of information request has revealed .
it showed the weight of household waste peaked in 2013 at 1,197 tonnes and has been falling steadily since .
last year 1,124 tonnes of houshold waste was collected .
st john was the first parish in jersey to introduce kerbside recycling .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: discovering guernsey 's weather with chris cumulus
text: weather watchers help british people engage in one of the nations favourite past times - talking about the weather .
guernsey weather watcher chris cumulus has shared some amazing photos of the island
he is out night and day sharing his weather shots .
he said : `` i own a digital slr camera and i occasionally feature after-dark reports using a tripod and remote shutter release to capture various phases of the moon .
`` on very clear nights i capture images of the milky way , as we have very little light pollution on the island at night . ''
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: reward offered for information after fire near tamba park
text: the owner of jersey 's dinosaur park , jonathan ruff , says he hopes someone will come forward with information about a fire in a glass house near the park at the end of august .
police are investigating the fire in st mary after fire officers said it was started deliberately .
mr ruff is offering a £ 5,000 reward for information that leads to the culprit being caught and arrested .
you live in hope someone knows something .
people talk , it 's a small island .
it might be a friend , someone might know something , they do n't want to say anything but ca n't turn down a large amount of money .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: calls to disband committee 'dismissed '
text: calls for the states assembly & constitution committee to be disbanded and its duties reallocated have been dismissed by its vice president .
author: Guernsey Press

documents.title: breakingcall for review of clinton pringle death case
text: the family of a toddler killed on a jersey road is asking the uk government for an independent review of court proceedings in jersey .
clinton pringle was near the millennium town park when he was struck by a van driven by rebekah le gal who got a suspended eight-month prison sentence for careless driving .
clinton 's father michael was in downing street today handing in a petition asking for shared space roads - where the road is shared with pedestrians - to be banned .
he says he has also handed in a request for an examination of how the court in jersey dealt with his son 's case .
we did n't get any sort of justice , we 've got a festering sore now and it was exasperated by the royal court in jersey .
i 'm asking for a full independent review of the legal proceedings by the court of appeal in jersey .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: 'biggest match in guernsey 's history '
text: batsman josh butler says guernsey have the mentality to come through their must-win world cricket league division five match against qatar on wednesday .
victory would put guernsey in the semi-finals - a win from promotion - but a loss would see them relegated .
`` from my experience we 're not a scrappy team , but we 're always fighting for survival , '' butler said .

channel islands sports editor tim pryor , in johannesburg , added : `` the clash with qatar is arguably the biggest match in guernsey 's international cricket history simply because of what is at stake . ''
author: James Law
BBC Sport Online

documents.title: rubbish bin fire put out by cleaners with a garden hose
text: a fire in a rubbish bin in jersey 's liberation square was put out by nearby cleaners using a garden hose .
police have warned people to make sure they put out their cigarettes carefully to avoid a similar incident happening again .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: afternoon weather : brighter later on
text: it will stay rather windy and cloudy this afternoon , and some rain is possible , but it should turn brighter later .
maximum temperature : 20 deg c ( 68 deg f )
jersey
guernsey
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: could st peter port be smoke free ?
text: st peter port in guernsey could be completely smoke free in the future if constable dennis le moignan gets his way .
he is about to put up signs making the area around a new bandstand alcohol free , but he says smoking and its litter is a bigger issue .
i 'd like to see a non-smoking area in st peter port .
it 's worse than the consumption of alcohol in public places .
the litter from cigarette ends is unbelievable and people do n't seem to care .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: momentum key for jersey - jenner
text: jersey batsman jonty jenner says momentum is key as they prepare for their final group game against ghana tomorrow in world cricket league division five .
the reds have so far won both their matches in south africa , against vanuatu and germany , and will guarantee a semi-final spot with another victory .
`` i do n't think we can really let our foot off the gas - in these tournaments because the games come so thick and fast momentum 's quite a big thing , '' jenner told bbc radio jersey .
captain chuggy perchard added : `` i think we 've got the quality to win that game as well - hopefully we will , i 'm sure we will . ''
author: James Law
BBC Sport Online

documents.title: new location for family festival
text: a popular family festival that has attracted thousands of people to gorey village for the past four years is being held at a new and larger location this weekend .
author: Jersey Evening Post

documents.title: guernsey colleges to have 'no public funding ' by 2026
text: guernsey 's education president , deputy paul le pelley says his goal is to see the three grant-aided colleges in the island operate without any public money from 2026 onwards .

he says the colleges are an integral part of the system , educating about 30 % of secondary school students and they 're expected to remain successful well into the future despite a planned £ 3.5m a year cut in government funding .
policy and resources committee criticised the proposals to cut funding by three quarters from 2018 and claim the plans lack clarity .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: 'put out cigarettes properly ' warns police
text: please dispose of cigarettes carefully .
@ twitterid thanks to castle cleaning for putting it out .
author: Twitter

documents.title: wins for jersey and guernsey in south africa
text: guernsey boosted their world cricket league division five promotion hopes with a six-wicket win over the cayman islands in south africa .
david hooper took 5-36 as the cayman islands slipped from 115-1 to 214-9 at the end of their 50 overs .
opener josh butler timed the ball superbly in guernsey 's reply , hitting 15 boundaries on his way to 93 as they reached 216-4 with 13.3 overs to spare .
author: Tim Pryor
BBC Sport

documents.title: fire 'caused thousands of pounds worth of damage '
text: a fire near tamba park in jersey caused thousands of pounds worth of damage with the bulk of the cost coming from the clean up operation , owner jonathan ruff has said .
police confirmed they were investigating the fire which happened last week inside a glass house next to the park after jersey 's fire service confirmed it was started deliberately .
mr ruff said he has had to improve security around the park including a number of night vision cctv cameras .
he says he hopes someone will come forward with more information and has offered a £ 5,000 reward that leads to the culprit being found .
author: Ryan Morrison
BBC News Online

documents.title: states lack the expertise to run aircraft registry , says deputy
text: jersey 's £ 860,000 aircraft registry should be handed over to ports of jersey as there `` may not be enough expertise '' to run it successfully , a backbench deputy has said .
author: Jersey Evening Post

documents.title: police probe continues after festivalgoers taken to hospital
text: jersey police are continuing to investigate after seven festivalgoers were taken to hospital on saturday .
they were attending the weekender festival in trinity .
it 's thought they took the drug mdma or ecstasy .
at least four other people also went to hospital in relation to drugs , police said .
festival organisers are yet to comment .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: today 's weather : turning drier and brighter later on
text: most places will start cloudy and wet .
later in the afternoon it will become drier , brighter and fresher .
maximum temperature : 20c ( 68f ) .
jersey
guernsey
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: police investigate 'deliberate ' fire near dinosaur park
text: jersey police are investigating a blaze next to tamba park on 27 august in a glass house after the fire service confirmed it was started deliberately .
the owner of the visitor attraction - jonathan ruff - is asking islanders to come forward with information that could help .
security cameras around the park are also being viewed .
mr ruff said that in such a small island someone must know something .
this was the second fire close to the park this year .
the last in april was sparked by the use of welding equipment on the teeth of a giant dinosaur .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: future of l'eree bay hotel uncertain as proprietor leaves
text: a guernsey hotelier will be closing the doors of the l'eree bay hotel for the final time this year .
author: Guernsey Press

documents.title: clinton pringle 's father in call to stop 'shared road spaces '
text: the father of a three-year-old boy killed in jersey is calling on the uk government to ban `` shared road spaces '' until they can be properly examined .
clinton pringle was hit as walked in a shared space area outside millennium town park in st helier while on holiday with his mother .
clinton 's father , michael pringle , said he believed shared spaces worked in other countries like the netherlands and denmark because there `` the pedestrian is king '' .
he will present a petition in downing street later today to call for a halt on the use of shared space schemes .
shared spaces , like the one in jersey , are an attempt to make drivers take more care by removing traffic signs , pedestrian crossings and even kerbs .
mr pringle was familiar with the concept as he lives near kirkintilloch where a shared space scheme is in operation in the town centre .
he has now joined forces with local campaigners there to highlight the dangers posed to blind , partially sighted and disabled people , as well as children .
author: Ryan Morrison
BBC News Online

documents.title: urgent review call for guernsey 's population law
text: guernsey 's new population management law which was launched in april needs an urgent review , according to the confederation of guernsey industry .
chairman clive mcminn says guernsey has to present itself as being open for business and current delays in processing applications prove the new regime is n't working efficiently .
he described the population management office as `` overly bureaucratic '' with applications taking too long .
home affairs committee president , deputy mary lowe , said some applications were taking too long but they have a plan to stabilise the issue and tackle the backlog but it could take some time .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: local live in the channel islands
text: good morning and welcome to bbc local live across the channel islands .
we 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather throughout the day .
if you want to get in touch , please email us .
author: Ryan Morrison
BBC News Online
